reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Emperador on the Gran Via expecting the traffic noise to an issue but it was fine. After all the walking no trouble sleeping. The hotel's location is probably its best asset. Drinks in the hotel bar were expensive. Continental breakfast ok but not really good.
reviews.title: Dated hotel but central location

reviews.title: Don't bet you can make use of the pool!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: City tour bus really easy way to get off and see things, we enjoyed a trip around the Bernabau stadium that way. Stop across the road from the hotel, really easy.
reviews.title: Inner city efficiency

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Room was quite adequate, enough space etc..not luxury but just fine for me. The gym ? ... rubbish. Highlights: Staff..very very good! Location: Excelllent: Roof top pool, again not luxury but a very nice feature with cool views and comfortable loungers. This is not a luxury hotel, but staff and pool make it above average. I will stay here again if less than 80 euro a night! BoyI am getting mean.
reviews.title: Good value, on balance..but not fantastic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: Spent 3 days in Madrid. Wanted a location that we could walk or take public transportation from. This fits the bill. Found it difficult in Madrid to find that many people that wanted to talk to English speakers. Hotel inclueded. Breakfast was ample, room was of standard size
reviews.title: Good location for madrid tours.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: with all the ammenities. All and all it was a pleasant stay.
reviews.title: Nice hotel at good location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed three nights in November at the Hotel Emperador. We stayed in one of the suites on the sixth floor, with fantastic views of the Grand Via. The suite was well furnished, maybe some old furniture. In need of upgrading. The beds were very comfortable.
reviews.title: Very pleasant stay! The roofpool is top of the pops!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Service at hotel was not so good. We had booked a romantic weekend packages, cava in the room. But there was no cava when we got to the room and we had no information about this when we checked in. When we asked the front desk so they said that cava comes in the room at 19.00. Strangely, there are perhaps people who want cava at a different time. We received no information about where Emperador club existed. All in all, bad information at check-in. The guys in the lobby bar was more interested in talking to each other than to serve the guests.
reviews.title: Great hotel, great location in Madrid

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is NOT a luxury hotel, it just offers some luxuries which you wouldn't expect. The rooms are a bit basic, but big enough, especially the bathroom it was lovely and big. The two amazing selling points about this hotel are the location (on the gran via, close to everything), and secondly the upstairs area with pool and sun lounges. The pool water is freezing, so being a wimp about the cold I didn't go in, but the terrace up there is so nice to sit on out there in the sun and have a glass or two of champers, so relaxing. I would come back to Emperador for sure! without a second thought
reviews.title: Great location, great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: Hotel Emperador is in Gran Via, walking distance to Plaza Mayor and other good places to eat and have drinks.
reviews.title: Good Hotel, well located

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: Good bar services and very good restaurant.
reviews.title: First class location and rooftop pool

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple

reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have just one observation: they dont have standard rooms, i.e. if your got a bad room, ask them for a better one!
reviews.title: Excellent weekend break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: good hotel,size of room large and comfortable on 6th floor.Location good,nearest metro station 3 mins. walk away is Calleo! The bar-lounge is excellent if a little pricey but after walking Madrid all day was a beautiful relaxing place to unwind! Would use this hotel again!
reviews.title: no problems

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just back from 2 nights in Madrid staying at this hotel. Pleased with our choice, fab location on Grand Via , one of the main streets in the city and within walking distance of all sites. Elegant, clean and with attentive staff. Room on small side and at back of hotel so no view but nice and quiet. Rooms at front apparantly are noisy from the street below. Breakfast was good, buffet, fresh and appealing and more than ample. Shame the roof terrace was closed, sign on reception states open May - Aug. Would have been lovely to sit up there at the end of the day with a drink and watch the sun go down - we had fab weather whilst we were there. There is this Emperador Club which no one tried to up grade or sell us. They have they own lounge area and an upgraded breakfast selection. No one seemed to take notice of the sign by the hot food at breakfast saying for Club guests only and people just helped them selves, even to the Champagne on offer!
reviews.title: Location, Location, Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012
reviews.text: Great Taps bar , out of the hotel turn left and across the road. La Mario (or similar), 2 drinks, tapas and ice cream for 9.50 euros each. Would recommend the walking and Tapas tour we found on Trip Advisor, with Get your Guide. 3 hours, with food and drink for under 12.00 Euros and was a fun way to spend an evening and trying venues and food we would never had ventured into.
reviews.title: Average hotel in a centric location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Would recommend this hotel without hesitation, we got a good deal via Travel Zoo and the comp bottle of Cava went down well after a long day walking our socks off!
reviews.title: good location

reviews.text: Good:

description: Emperador Hotel in Madrid is perfectly located in the lively Gran Vía of Madrid, only a few minutes of the main tourist attractions in the capital. It offers 232 guestrooms, meeting rooms and an amazing rooftop with terrace and swimming pool in season. Other services in the hotel: gym, souvenirs shop, hairdressing, steam bath and valet parking, among others.
